pli-tv-pvr1.16:1.1: As a result of having sexual intercourse, how many kinds of offenses does one commit?
pli-tv-pvr1.16:1.2: One commits four kinds of offenses:
pli-tv-pvr1.16:1.3: when one has sexual intercourse with an undecomposed corpse, one commits an offense entailing expulsion;
pli-tv-pvr1.16:1.4: when one has sexual intercourse with a mostly decomposed corpse, one commits a serious offense;
pli-tv-pvr1.16:1.5: when one inserts one’s penis into a wide open mouth without touching it, one commits an offense of wrong conduct;
pli-tv-pvr1.16:1.6: when one uses a dildo, one commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-pvr1.16:1.8: When it comes to these offenses, to how many of the four kinds of failure do they belong?
pli-tv-pvr1.16:1.9: In how many of the seven classes of offenses are they found?
pli-tv-pvr1.16:1.10: Through how many of the six kinds of originations of offenses do they originate?
pli-tv-pvr1.16:1.11: To which of the four kinds of legal issues do they belong?
pli-tv-pvr1.16:1.12: Through how many of the seven principles for settling legal issues are they settled?
pli-tv-pvr1.16:1.13: They belong to two kinds of failure:
pli-tv-pvr1.16:1.14: they may be failure in morality; they may be failure in conduct.
pli-tv-pvr1.16:1.15: They are found in four classes of offenses:
pli-tv-pvr1.16:1.16: they may be in the class of offenses entailing expulsion; they may be in the class of serious offenses; they may be in the class of offenses entailing confession; they may be in the class of offenses of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-pvr1.16:1.18: from body and mind, not from speech.
pli-tv-pvr1.16:1.19: They belong to legal issues arising from an offense.
pli-tv-pvr1.16:1.20: They are settled through three principles:
pli-tv-pvr1.16:1.21: they may be settled by resolution face-to-face and by acting according to what has been admitted; or they may be settled by resolution face-to-face and by covering over as if with grass. …
pli-tv-pvr1.16:2.1: As a result of, out of disrespect, defecating, urinating, or spitting in water, how many kinds of offenses does one commit?
pli-tv-pvr1.16:2.2: One commits one kind of offense:
pli-tv-pvr1.16:2.5: When it comes to this offense, to how many of the four kinds of failure does it belong?
pli-tv-pvr1.16:2.6: In how many of the seven classes of offenses is it found?
pli-tv-pvr1.16:2.7: Through how many of the six kinds of originations of offenses does it originate?
pli-tv-pvr1.16:2.8: To which of the four kinds of legal issues does it belong?
pli-tv-pvr1.16:2.9: Through how many of the seven principles for settling legal issues is it settled?
pli-tv-pvr1.16:2.10: It belongs to one kind of failure:
pli-tv-pvr1.16:2.12: It is found in one class of offenses:
pli-tv-pvr1.16:2.13: in the class of offenses of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-pvr1.16:2.15: from body and mind, not from speech.
pli-tv-pvr1.16:2.16: It belongs to legal issues arising from an offense.
pli-tv-pvr1.16:2.17: It is settled through three principles:
pli-tv-pvr1.16:2.18: it may be settled by resolution face-to-face and by acting according to what has been admitted; or it may be settled by resolution face-to-face and by covering over as if with grass.
pli-tv-pvr1.16:3.1: The gathering up section, the eighth, is finished.
pli-tv-pvr1.16:3.2: The eight sections on “as a result of” are finished.
pli-tv-pvr1.16:3.3: The sixteen great sections in The Great Analysis are finished.
pli-tv-pvr1.16:4.1: The great section of the Monks’ Analysis is finished.
